column4: Could anyone know the proper steps to install the lastest nvidia drivers on Gutsy?
thanks ubotu...I've read that, but I want to try the lastest drivers
...an truly want to learn how to do it "by hand" :)
- you may be able to download from nVidia direct - I did this with my debian box
sure danand, I did it, and run it, but when I reboot I have no graphic interface anymore
- the package you get needs to compile a module for your kernel - so you might need kernel headers / source etc
manro - ignore last then - i type too slow!!
no problem, thanks :D
any suggestion?
any other! :D
manro - have you looked in your x log for errors??
- /var/log/Xorg.0.log
I have, but that truth is that I'm new at linux, and do no understand that very well :S
a noob here :P
right now I'm using the drivers installed by ENVY, and is working OK
but what bothers me is the fact that I can't install the drivers "by hand" :S
manro - dont worry someone will always be able to help - at command line type cat /var/log/Xorg.0.log | grep EE and see what turns up
ok...I'll "install" the driver again and post the log :)
- thanks a lot buddy!
- no problem
